<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 18"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Improbable Elixirs](/Feats.aspx?ID=123) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Alchemist" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=7" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 81 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

</column>

---

Your mastery of alchemical secrets enables you to replicate effects most believe can be achieved only via magic. Select a number of [potions](/equipment/consumables/potions) equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1); these potions must be of 9th level or lower. You gain formulas to create these potions as alchemical items with the [elixir](/Traits.aspx?ID=59) trait. When making these alchemical elixirs, you can substitute alchemical reagents for an equal value of magical components, and you can use [alchemist's tools](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2) (for [Quick Alchemy](/Feats.aspx?ID=667)) or an [alchemist's lab](/Equipment.aspx?ID=543) (for the [Craft](/Actions.aspx?ID=43) activity) instead of any other required tool kits. Other than that, the formula does not change. Once you've chosen the potion formulas, they can't be changed.
name: Improbable Elixirs
